cascade.exoplanet_tools package¶

Submodules¶

cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools module¶

This Module defines the functionality to get catalog data on the targeted exoplanet and define the model ligth curve for the system

@author: bouwman

cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools.KmagToJy(magnitude: Unit("Kmag"), system='Johnson')¶

Convert Kband Magnitudes to Jy

cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools.JytoKmag(flux: Unit("Jy"), system='Johnson')¶

Convert flux in Jy to Kband Magnitudes

cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools.SurfaceGravity(MassPlanet: Unit("jupiterMass"), RadiusPlanet: Unit("jupiterRad"))¶

Calculates surface gravity of planet

MassPlanet
Mass of planet in units of Jupiter mass or equivalent
RadiusPlanet
Radius of planet in units of Jupiter radius or equivalent

Surface gravity in units of m s-2

cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools.ScaleHeight(MeanMolecularMass: Unit("u"), SurfaceGravity: Unit("m / s2"), Temperature: Unit("K"))¶

Calculate the scaleheigth of the planet

MeanMolecularMass
in units of mass of the hydrogen atom or equivalent
SurfaceGravity
in units of m s-2 or equivalent
Temperature
in units of K or equivalent
scaleheigth in unit of km
cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools.TransitDepth(RadiusPlanet: Unit("jupiterRad"), RadiusStar: Unit("solRad"))¶

Calculates the depth of the planetary transit assuming one can neglect the emision from the night side of the planet.

Radius Planet
in Jovian radii or equivalent
Radius Star
in Solar radii or equivalent

relative transit depth (unit less)

cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools.Planck(wavelength: Unit("micron"), temperature: Unit("K"))¶

This function calculates the emisison from a Black Body.

wavelength
Input wavelength in units of microns or equivalent
temperature
Input temperature in units of Kelvin or equivalent

B_nu in cgs units [ erg/s/cm2/Hz/sr]

cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools.EquilibriumTemperature(StellarTemperature: Unit("K"), StellarRadius: Unit("solRad"), SemiMajorAxis: Unit("AU"), Albedo=0.3, epsilon=0.7)¶

Calculate the Equlibrium Temperature of the Planet

StellarTemperature
in units of K or equivalent
StellarRadius
in units of Solar Radii or equivalent

Albedo SemiMajorAxis

in units of AU or equivalent
epsilon
Green house effect parameter

Equlibrium Temperature

cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools.get_calalog(catalog_name, update=True)¶

Get exoplanet catalog data Input: —— catalog_name

name of catalog to use
cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools.parse_database(catalog_name, update=True)¶

Read CSV files containing exoplanet catalog data

cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools.convert_spectrum_to_brighness_temperature(wavelength: Unit("micron"), contrast: Unit("%"), StellarTemperature: Unit("K"), StellarRadius: Unit("solRad"), RadiusPlanet: Unit("jupiterRad"), error: Unit("%") = None)¶

Function to convert the secondary eclipse spectrum to brightness temperature.

cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools.combine_spectra(identifier_list=[], path='')¶

Convienience function to combine multiple extracted spectra of the same source by calculating a weighted averige. Input: ——

identifier_list

path

combined_spectrum
cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools.extract_exoplanet_data(data_list, target_name_or_position, coord_unit=None, coordinate_frame='icrs', search_radius=<Quantity 5. arcsec>)¶

Extract the data record for a single target Input: data_list

List containing table with exoplanet data
target_name_or_position
Name of the target or coordinates of the target for which the record is extracted
coord_unit
unit of coordinates e.g (u.hourangle, u.deg)
coordinate_frame
Frame of coordinate system e.g icrs
Output:
list containing data record of the specified planet
class cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools.lightcuve¶

Bases: object

valid_models = {'batman'}¶
class cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools.batman_model¶

Bases: object

ReturnParFromDB()¶
ReturnParFromIni()¶
static define_batman_model(InputParameter)¶

This function defines the light curve model used to analize the transit or eclipse. We use the batman package to calculate the light curves.We assume here a symmetric transit signal, that the secondary transit is at phase 0.5 and primary transit at 0.0. INPUT: —— InputParameter:

Ordered dict containing all needed inut parameter to define model
cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools.masked_array_input(func)¶

If one of the input arguments is wavelength or flux, the array can be a masked Quantity, masking out only ‘bad’ data. This decorator checks for masked arrays and upon finding the first masked array, passes the data and stores the mask to be used to create a masked Quantity after the function returns.

cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools.eclipse_to_transit(eclipse)¶

Converts eclipse spectrum to transit spectrum

cascade.exoplanet_tools.exoplanet_tools.transit_to_eclipse(transit)¶

Converts transit spectrum to eclipse spectrum

static define_batman_model(InputParameter)¶

This function defines the light curve model used to analize the transit or eclipse. We use the batman package to calculate the light curves.We assume here a symmetric transit signal, that the secondary transit is at phase 0.5 and primary transit at 0.0. INPUT: —— InputParameter:

cascade.exoplanet_tools.masked_array_input(func)¶

If one of the input arguments is wavelength or flux, the array can be a masked Quantity, masking out only ‘bad’ data. This decorator checks for masked arrays and upon finding the first masked array, passes the data and stores the mask to be used to create a masked Quantity after the function returns.
